name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3479
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the effect of the trifluoromethyl group, the methyl group, and the overall molecular weight. The trifluoromethyl group is known to increase the melting point due to its high electronegativity and the resulting strong intermolecular interactions. The methyl group has a smaller effect, as it reduces the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The overall molecular weight is increased due to the trifluoromethyl group, which contributes to a higher melting point.
